candidates.description:
Move method to com.mvnforum.user.PostWebHandler
Rationale: The prepareAdd method is primarily concerned with preparing the context for adding a post, which directly relates to the responsibilities of the PostWebHandler class. It handles user permissions, forum checks, and post preparation, making it a natural fit.

Move method to net.myvietnam.mvncore.interceptor.ContentInterceptor
Rationale: The method is responsible for loading a ContentInterceptor based on the class name provided, making it most appropriate to reside within the ContentInterceptor class itself.

Move method to net.myvietnam.mvncore.interceptor.MailInterceptor
Rationale: The method 'loadMailInterceptor' is directly related to loading and setting a MailInterceptor instance, making it most appropriate to reside within the MailInterceptor class.

Move method to net.myvietnam.mvncore.interceptor.LoginIDInterceptor
Rationale: The method is specifically designed to load and instantiate a LoginIDInterceptor class, making it most appropriate to reside within the LoginIDInterceptor class itself.

Move method to net.myvietnam.mvncore.interceptor.PasswordInterceptor
Rationale: The method is specifically designed to load and instantiate a PasswordInterceptor class, making it most appropriate to reside within the PasswordInterceptor class itself.

suggested_move_methods.method_signature: public void prepareAdd(PostWebHandler postWebHandler, GenericRequest request, GenericResponse response)
suggested_move_methods.rationale: The prepareAdd method is heavily involved in the logic of preparing a post, which aligns more closely with the responsibilities of the PostWebHandler class. Moving it there would adhere to the Single Responsibility Principle.

The loading logic for the ContentInterceptor is specific to the ContentInterceptor class. Moving this method would encapsulate the loading behavior within the interceptor itself, promoting better cohesion.
Similar to loadContentInterceptor, this method is specific to the MailInterceptor class. Moving it would enhance the encapsulation of the loading logic within the MailInterceptor.
This method is responsible for loading the LoginIDInterceptor, which is a specific behavior of the LoginIDInterceptor class. Moving it would improve the separation of concerns.

The loading logic for the PasswordInterceptor is specific to the PasswordInterceptor class. Moving this method would encapsulate the loading behavior within the interceptor itself, promoting better cohesion.

suggested_move_methods.method_signature: public void prepareAdd(PostWebHandler postWebHandler, GenericRequest request, GenericResponse response)
suggested_move_methods.rationale: The prepareAdd method is heavily involved in preparing data for adding a post, which aligns more closely with the responsibilities of the PostWebHandler class. Moving it there would adhere to the Single Responsibility Principle.
The loading of interceptors is a distinct responsibility that could be encapsulated in a separate InterceptorLoader class, improving the separation of concerns.
Similar to loadContentInterceptor, this method is part of the interceptor loading logic and should be moved to an InterceptorLoader class for better organization.
This method is also related to loading interceptors and should be moved to the InterceptorLoader class to maintain a clean architecture.
This method is part of the interceptor loading process and should be moved to the InterceptorLoader class to enhance code clarity and maintainability.

suggested_move_methods.rationale: The prepareAdd method is heavily involved in preparing data for adding a post, which aligns more closely with the responsibilities of the PostWebHandler class. Moving it there would adhere to the Single Responsibility Principle.
The loading of interceptors is a distinct responsibility that could be encapsulated in a separate InterceptorLoader class, improving the separation of concerns.
Similar to loadContentInterceptor, this method is part of the interceptor loading logic and should be moved to an InterceptorLoader class for better organization.
This method is also related to loading interceptors and should be moved to the InterceptorLoader class to maintain a clean architecture.

suggested_move_methods.method_signature: public void prepareAdd(PostWebHandler postWebHandler, GenericRequest request, GenericResponse response)
suggested_move_methods.rationale: The prepareAdd method is heavily involved in the logic of preparing a post, which aligns more closely with the responsibilities of the PostWebHandler class. Moving it there would adhere to the Single Responsibility Principle.

The loading logic for the ContentInterceptor is specific to the ContentInterceptor class. Moving this method would encapsulate the loading behavior within the interceptor itself, promoting better cohesion.
Similar to loadContentInterceptor, this method is specific to the MailInterceptor class. Moving it would enhance the encapsulation of the loading logic within the MailInterceptor.
This method is responsible for loading the LoginIDInterceptor, which is a specific behavior of the LoginIDInterceptor class. Moving it would improve the separation of concerns.

candidates.description:
Move method to com.mvnforum.categorytree.impl.CategoryTreeListenerImpl
Rationale: The method heavily interacts with permissions, request, and response objects that are part of the CategoryTreeListenerImpl class. It also uses the onlineUser and locale attributes, which are likely part of this class, making it more appropriate for the method to reside here.

suggested_move_methods.method_signature: public String drawForum2(CategoryTreeListenerImpl categoryTreeListenerImpl, CategoryTreeEvent event)
suggested_move_methods.rationale: The drawForum2 method contains logic related to rendering forum data and permissions, which is more appropriate for a service class that handles forum-related operations.
The updateIconLegend method is focused on managing the state of forum icons, which should be handled by a dedicated service class responsible for icon management.

suggested_move_methods.method_signature: public String drawForum2(CategoryTreeListenerImpl categoryTreeListenerImpl, CategoryTreeEvent event)
suggested_move_methods.rationale: The drawForum2 method contains logic related to rendering forum data and permissions, which is more appropriate for a service class that handles forum-related operations rather than being part of the ForumIconLegend class.
The updateIconLegend method is responsible for updating the state of forum icons based on their status, which should be managed by a dedicated service class that handles forum icon logic.

suggested_move_methods.method_signature: public String drawForum2(CategoryTreeListenerImpl categoryTreeListenerImpl, CategoryTreeEvent event)
suggested_move_methods.rationale: The drawForum2 method contains logic related to rendering forum data and permissions, which is more appropriate for a service class that handles forum-related operations rather than being part of the ForumIconLegend class.
The updateIconLegend method is responsible for updating the state of forum icons based on their status, which should be managed by a dedicated service class that handles forum icon logic.

suggested_move_methods.method_signature: public String drawForum2(CategoryTreeListenerImpl categoryTreeListenerImpl, CategoryTreeEvent event)
suggested_move_methods.rationale: The drawForum2 method contains logic related to rendering forum data and permissions, which is more appropriate for a service class that handles forum-related operations.
The updateIconLegend method is focused on managing the state of forum icons, which should be handled by a dedicated service class responsible for icon management.

candidates.description:
Move method to com.mvnforum.user.PostWebHandler
Rationale: The deletePost method directly interacts with post-related functionalities, such as checking permissions, deleting attachments, and updating the post in the database. It is more appropriate for this method to reside in the PostWebHandler class, which is responsible for handling operations related to posts.

suggested_move_methods.method_signature: public void deletePost(GenericRequest request, PostWebHandler postWebHandler) throws DatabaseException, AuthenticationException, BadInputException, ObjectNotFoundException
suggested_move_methods.rationale: The deletePost method handles business logic related to post deletion, including permission checks and interactions with other services. It should be moved to a dedicated service class (PostService) to separate concerns and improve maintainability.
The management of attachments is a distinct concern from the PostBean. Moving this method to an AttachmentService class would better encapsulate attachment-related functionality.
Similar to getAttachmentBeans, this method deals with attachment management and should be moved to an AttachmentService class to maintain separation of concerns.

suggested_move_methods.method_signature: public void deletePost(GenericRequest request, PostWebHandler postWebHandler) throws DatabaseException, AuthenticationException, BadInputException, ObjectNotFoundException
suggested_move_methods.rationale: The deletePost method handles business logic related to post deletion, including permission checks and interactions with other services. It should be moved to a dedicated service class (PostService) to separate concerns and improve maintainability.
The management of attachments is a distinct concern from the PostBean. Moving getAttachmentBeans to an AttachmentService class would better encapsulate attachment-related functionality.
Similar to getAttachmentBeans, setAttachmentBeans is related to attachment management and should be moved to an AttachmentService class to maintain separation of concerns.

suggested_move_methods.method_signature: public void deletePost(GenericRequest request, PostWebHandler postWebHandler) throws DatabaseException, AuthenticationException, BadInputException, ObjectNotFoundException
suggested_move_methods.rationale: The deletePost method handles business logic related to post deletion, including permission checks and updating statistics. It would be more appropriate to move this method to a dedicated service class (PostService) that manages post-related operations.
The method getAttachmentBeans is related to managing attachments. It would be better suited in an AttachmentService class that handles operations related to attachments.
Similar to getAttachmentBeans, the setAttachmentBeans method is related to managing attachments and should be moved to an AttachmentService class.

suggested_move_methods.method_signature: public void deletePost(GenericRequest request, PostWebHandler postWebHandler) throws DatabaseException, AuthenticationException, BadInputException, ObjectNotFoundException
suggested_move_methods.rationale: The deletePost method handles business logic related to post deletion, including permission checks and interactions with other services. It should be moved to a dedicated service class (PostService) to separate concerns and improve maintainability.
The management of attachments is a distinct concern from the PostBean. Moving this method to an AttachmentService class would better encapsulate attachment-related functionality.
Similar to getAttachmentBeans, this method deals with attachment management and should be moved to an AttachmentService class to maintain separation of concerns.
